title: Configure a load balancer for port 443
content:
This topic describes how to configure an external load balancer (LB) for the Suite and expose the LB's port 443 to allow clients to access the Suite administration interface.

Expose port 443 on external LB (ClusterIP service)

Refer to the instructions in this section if your Suite deployment uses ClusterIP service to expose the LB.  

After you complete the suite installation, you must update the OpenShift Router to add a route to allow external clients to access the suite user interface on port 443.

Log in to the OpenShift web console

  1. Launch the OpenShift web console. For example, https://console-openshift-console.apps.myhost.example.com.
  2. Log in to the web console as kubeadmin and use the password that you specified during the OpenShift cluster installation. 

Create a route for port 443

In the Yaml view, enter the following information. Then, switch to Form view and verify all the fields are filled with the correct values. You need to switch to Yaml view again to create the route.

Complete the following steps to create the route for port 443. 

  1. Navigate to Networking > Routes, select itsma-xxxxx from the project list, and then click Create Route. 
  2. Provide the following information for the route:
    • Name: enter a descriptive name.
    • Hostname: enter the external access hostname that you specified when running the install script. The external hostname should also resolve to the master hostname.
    • Path: Leave this field blank. Remove the "/" if  it is the default.
    • Service: select itom-ingress-controller-svc from the drop-down list. If the drop-down doesn't have itom-ingress-controller-svc -- shift to YAML view and add itom-ingress-controller-svc. Switch back to Form view
    • Security:  Select Secure route, and then select  Passthrough  in the TLS Termination field.
    • Other settings: keep their default value.
  3. Click Create.
  4. Log in to suite administration interface, for example, https://<external access host name>/bo,  as suite-admin and verify the configuration.
